Question.Subject: what legible sites can i go to, to download these browsers?
Question.Content: internet explorer, googe chrome, firefox, mozilla----which of these should i install?
Question.ChosenAnswer:
http://www.microsoft.com/windows/internet-explorer http://www.google.com/chrome http://www.firefox.com <- It's Mozilla Firefox btw, it's one browser
Chrome is the fastest of the three and by far the most secure, but I happen to like Firefox's UI better. I.E. 8 is better than the older versions (like I.E. 6 which is preinstalled on Windows XP), but it's still lacking in the standards support, it's got more security holes than Chrome and Firefox, and it's about 1/10th of Chrome's speed when it comes to Javascript-heavy sites like Yahoo Mail.

Answer.Content: Legible......I'll take it that you mean legitimate. If you want a browser, go for Opera

chrome: http://www.google.com/chrome firefox: firefox.com internet explorer: http://www.microsoft.com/windows/internet-explorer/default.aspx
download firefox. it never fails me

http://www.microsoft.com/windows/internet-explorer http://www.google.com/chrome http://www.firefox.com <- It's Mozilla Firefox btw, it's one browser
Chrome is the fastest of the three and by far the most secure, but I happen to like Firefox's UI better. I.E. 8 is better than the older versions (like I.E. 6 which is preinstalled on Windows XP), but it's still lacking in the standards support, it's got more security holes than Chrome and Firefox, and it's about 1/10th of Chrome's speed when it comes to Javascript-heavy sites like Yahoo Mail.

Fire Fox is by far the best and I use it always for ease and stability.
http://www.mozilla.com/en-US/firefox/upgrade.html

google chrome is by far the fastest and most reliable,mozilla firefox is not to bad,but internet explorer which is part of windows itself has a lot of problems. those are the three main ones. so yes of course my recommendation is google chrome
